ygData.messageBody:
>
> I am new to the list and have Jeweling questions for you.
> My questions involves training points.
> After you spend the max 21 points at the guild and you get to your next
> level can you put those 5 into your Jewel Craft skill? Can you do this at
> each level?

no, and no

> I realize you may not want to do this or advise it, but is it possible?

no

>
> What reasons would you give for NOT putting your training points into
Jewel
> Craft at each level, even if you only put in 1 or 2.

no reason, if I could I certainly would... I spend most of my points in
languages now

>
> Also, after you reach 16th, how hard is it to do research and advance it?

Its hard, but dont worry you'll be doing it for a long long time

> Should I save points for Specialization?

Only one point per each specialization. I suggest that you decide what you
want to specialize in ( I hear most enchanters specialize in alteration, I
know I did). When you get level 16, train one point into each
specialization, and then go outside and cast a spell from your 'main'
specialization repeatedly, until specialize:alteration (or conjur, evoc,
whatever) reaches 51... then no other specializations will beat it and you
can go about your daily business.

>
> Thanks.

my pleasure!

>
> --
> Bahir
> 3rd Season DE Enchanter
> Bertoxx
>

Cogg - Rallos Zek (30)
